command.description: Command run on creations and updates. This should be idempotent so that it can be executed any amount of times. This will also be run for reverting deletion failures.

destroy_command.description: Command run on deletions. This should be idempotent so that it can be executed any amount of times. If it fails, command for creation will be run.

destroy_expect.description: Same as expect, but for destroy command.

expect.description: The value that stdout is expected to be with trimming space characters. The output does not match, creations and updates will fail.

permissions.description: Permission information in ^[0-7][0-7][0-7]$ form that each block represents user, group and others access in order, and each bits in blocks represents read, write and execute permissions. This is compatible with the stat(1) command `stat -c %a`. For example, you can use 777 to grant all full access, or use can use 644 for restricted access.

remote_path.description: Remote path to place the file. Take care to avoid including spaces or other special characters. These may be troublesome when being interpreted by remote shell.

client_private_key_pem.description: Client private key in PEM format.

host_publickey_authorized_key.description: Host public key trusted in authorized_keys (sshd(8)) format.

insecure_ignore_host_key.description: Insecurely trust the host public key. This may potentially cause Man-In-The-Middle attack.

port.description: If no port specified, 22 is used as default port.
